page.title: 03Employment
page.content: Cheddleton has grown from from a very small hamlet to a village with a population of 6,500. Brittains Paper Mills provided employment for men and women. A row of houses were built for them in 19xx. Joshua Wardle Ltd. at Leekbrook needed more workers as they expanded. St. Edwards Psychiatric Hospital provided employment for ancillary staff (nurses male and female had to come from a distance of 50 miles before they were employed by the hospital). St. Edwards Hospital will close about the year 2000. Joshua Wardle Ltd. are still dyeing and manufacturing textiles. There do not appear to have been any disputes between management and employees when Brittains had to lay off a number of their workers. This has been achieved amicably.
